name: Charlie Walter
summary: With over a decade of experience in Front End Development, I pride myself on impressive, accessible and cohesive UI and the maintainable, performant and scalable code that I produce. I am passionate about UX and enjoy the part my job plays between business logic and creativity. I lead and manage teams to deliver high-quality products that go beyond expectations. I have excellent communication and collaboration skills and encourage feedback, learning and growth in both product and people. I am loyal and committed to the companies I work for and welcome long-term projects that challenge and grow me.

career.title: UI/UX Developer

company.name: Jaid
company.summary: AI-powered platform that interprets and organizes communications and sends them to the right place for resolution.

career.description: At Jaid, my work played a crucial role in enhancing the Jaid product, making it more robust and user-friendly. It was an exciting journey, shaping the way our product interacted with users. I took pride in designing and implementing the foundation for new features, laying the groundwork for scalability and maintainability.

career.title: Senior Front End Developer (UI)

company.name: GameBench
company.summary: Mobile game performance monitoring and analytics tool.

career.description: During my tenure at Gamebench, I designed and developed multiple major iterations of the Dashboard. This web-based tool enables users to monitor and analyse the performance of their games. I enhanced the app’s accessibility with various improvements, including the introduction of a dark mode.

career.title: Front End Technical Lead and Team Manager

company.name: White Hat Gaming
company.summary: Casino and Sportsbook Player Account Management solution.

career.description: In this role, I hired, led, and mentored a talented team of 30 developers, ensuring the timely delivery of various projects with high quality. Additionally, I was responsible for maintaining and developing the company’s codebase, as well as its documentation and code guidelines.

career.title: Senior Front End Developer

company.name: White Hat Gaming
company.summary: Casino and Sportsbook Player Account Management solution.

career.description: During my first year at WHG, I modernised a legacy codebase, initiating the transition to a modern framework. This was accomplished while simultaneously delivering on business requirements and ensuring quality. As the sole Front-End (FE) resource, I developed the core white-label Angular library offering. This streamlined development and enabled a scalable, maintainable, and highly configurable casino library that complied with multiple jurisdictions. This groundwork laid the foundation for a system that would power over 40 casinos, a system that remains in use today.

How to Make a Smartphone Controlled 3D Web Game
Using Templating Engines to Streamline WordPress Theme Development
Building a 3D Multiplayer Game with Pusher
